summary: Good and bad
pros: Great brand name, pretty high quality engineering. Very strong products and company.
cons: Management and politics; not great perks, not very diverse work environment

summary: Good job to learn a lot at
pros: You’ll learn things very fast and get the chance to work on a lot of high impact tasks (team dependent)
cons: At times the on calls can be harsh and experience varies a lot across teams

summary: Not great now a days
pros: Used to be great place to work. If you are in good team, you can learn a lot in short time. Great to start career
cons:
Promotions are not faster if the work is done and capabilities are shown
Now, it changed to rat race and back stabbing culture

summary: Good place for completely self-sufficient engineers to thrive
pros: Lots of ownership and opportunities to learn and grow. Promotion from SDE1 -> SDE2 can be very fast if your manager likes you. Knowledge sharing is generally pretty good across the company as the culture encourages providing as much information as possible so you can do things on your own without needing to ask for help.
cons: WLB becomes nonexistent on AWS teams for a couple months every year leading up to re:Invent. Wouldn’t recommend AWS to new grads unless you excel at figuring things out on your own. Out of the six new grads (myself included) that joined my team over the last five years, four were PIPed due to not being independent enough.

summary: Just Incompetent ones playing Politics !!
pros:
Good if you want to make money, for a short span at the cost of your mental health and want to make
it a stint!
cons: Favoritism all around, managers play politics and soon you will be Pipped in no time with no solid proofs.

summary: Excellent compensation, everything else is horrible
pros: Compensation is pretty great. But the vesting schedule will make it difficult to realize since most people leave after a year or two.
cons: Literally everything besides comp. WLB is horrible, culture sucks, management is always moving the goal posts and deliverables. Culture of micromanagers that want to know everything that’s going on and then get angry at you asking questions. Would not recommend unless it’s your only option.

summary: Boring work, boring culture
pros: - Logo helps you advance to other positions in whatever field you choose.
cons:
- pay is terrible
- wlb is non existent
- no culture

summary: Good Team
pros: Teammates are helpful and amazing. I don't know much about projects and on call
cons: Management seems bad, people keep complaining but I feel it doesn't matter entry level

summary: It really depends...
pros:
Customer obsession, but less so now...
Brand name for CV
cons:
L8s are getting spineless now
Lack of empathy, especially the India org

summary: Your experience greatly depends on your team and manager
pros: Your experience could be good if your manager is good.
cons: Your experience could be terrible if your manager is terrible.

summary: Good to grow your career
pros: Smart people, good internal tooling, lots of opportunities to build things end to end
cons: Management can be disorganized, lots of red tape, lots of carrot dangling for promotions

summary: Great place to learn, grow and develop a solid foundation of skills and experiences.
pros: Learned a ton. Built out processes and teams. Making impact to real things that customers will experience.
cons: Every year during compensation reviews, Amazon will find new ways and take every opportunity to limit your compensation.

summary: Good Compensation, Good Career Growth opportunities till Senior Level. Bad Management, Bad Culture
pros: The Compensation provided and opportunities to work on large scale products
cons: There are many orgs that are very low in creativity and invention. If you get to such team, It will be only politics and no learning.

summary: Slow career growths especially in nontech
pros: program management space is challenging and amazing full of self-growth if not career growth
cons:
slow promos
incompetent managers
lots of middle management, as an L4 i would be much more happier if i could coordinate directly with L7 rather than waiting for my L6 to take things up

summary: As good as you make it out to be
pros:
- Can learn a lot if you look for it
- Pay is competitive now, although still very few perks
cons:
- Perks are worth pennies
- Company culture means you can't coast. Also really hard to go from L5 to L6.

summary: Hustle culture, and a “game” that can be mastered
pros:
-strong stock
- smart people everywhere, overall
- behemoth company that can flex when it wants to
cons:
- millions of teams moving in different directions
- constant reorgs and political battles 
- RTO
- if it’s not AI related, its deprioritized

summary: Great place to learn and grow.
pros: Compensation is great and there are more learning opportunities than you can ask for.
cons: 5 days in the office and the risk of being relocated.

summary: 10 yrs, still happy at Amazon (AWS)
pros: Get to lead really cutting edge programs.  Surrounded by really smart people.
cons: Work life balance can be bad. Your Career progression is yours and you alone own it - the sooner you realize that, the more comfortable you will be in Amazon.

summary: Dependent on org and leader
pros: Ability to move around and learn all types of businesses.
cons: Expectations are not standardized. Folks with large scope and breadth may not be recognized vs another person 3 yrs ago in a lesser space.

summary: Worst work life balance
pros: Good compensation for senior joh roles. Team culture can be good in some teams
cons: Very low WLB. Manager has politucs for promotions and favour who is close to manager

summary: The experience highly depends on teams and leadership. I had a very bad work life balance.
pros:
- easy internal transfers
- if you are in good team, you'll get to work in latest tech
cons:
- bad work life balance 
- you'll be stuck at the same role if your manager keeps changing

summary: Alright
pros: A lot of opportunity for career growth and ability to learn a lot out the gate
cons: Not a lot of benefits, Worst benefits out of the "best" companies

summary: Poor management and lots of politics
pros: Pay is fine. Good if your team and manager is good
cons:
Poor management and lots of politics 

Lots of backstabbing 
.

summary: Sporadic work culture. Goals will be decided in advance. Personal life / WLB might be impacted based on project.
pros: Good brand value and compensation. Chance to work at high level, large scale impacting business problems.
cons:
Long working hours
Personal life / health  / sleep might be impacted.
May find difficult to get leaves.

summary: Amazon's not for everyone
pros: You may end up working on something extraordinary if you are in a role or position that allows you to be a part of "building something" This can be a good place for those who want to experience "climbing up a ladder" because Amazon has built a very LONG one.
cons: Didn't work for me. This is a perfect place if you want to waste time learning how to play politics instead of doing actual work. Productivity theatre, backstab, makeup stuff. In such a large organization, the truth takes a LONG time to be revealed.  Under the "ambiguity" principle, they will let unethical situations slip. However, most people who say they love Amazon have been there since after undergrad. If you have moved around a lot and experienced several different types of companies, Amazon will feel bland. It also depends on the team and the nature of the role. Def don't recommend for people who love actual sales roles that are strategic

summary: If your Manager is supportive and if he doesnt indulge in politics, Amazon is a great place to work. (If and Only if)
pros:
Work life balance in certain teams.
Pay.
If you are starting your career, then good place to learn.
cons:
Politics and not so good work in most team.
Saturated and doesn’t have any innovation.

summary: Good for l couple years
pros:
Career growth opportunities and
Impactful projects. Smart people around and reasonable team size
cons:
Change of leadership can change everything .
Non technical manager leads software teams can be an issue

summary: Worst work life balance
pros: Lot of learning at scale and learning new technology here.
cons: Worst work life balance and bad pay to compensate hard work.

summary: Toxic workplace
pros: This place looks great on your resume, until you're talking to someone who used to work at Amazon. Then, it's kinda a red flag.
cons: The work culture totally tanked my growth and ability to do my job, so I'm out of there as soon as I can be.

summary: Management filled with chads with fragile ego
pros:
* great compensation
* great place to increase mental stress
* working here helped me get so much closer to my therapist as I needed more number of sessions and more frequent sessions that I ended up marrying my therapist
cons: egoist management who loses their mind on junior engineers because engineer’s suggestion were practical enough to not meet management’s hypothetical 15 year goal
